title: Parents indicted in shooting of 5-year-old Macon boy
content:
Parents indicted in shooting of 5-year-old Macon boy
The mother of a 5-year-old Macon boy shot in the face now faces criminal charges along with the boy’s father, who was arrested soon after the March 10 incident.
Bibb County sheriff’s deputies were called to the family’s house on Grand Avenue just after 5 p.m. after Jakalon Jenkins’ 8-year-old brother accidentally shot his younger brother in his right cheek.
Anthony Jennings Jr., 38, and Natasha Jenkins, 35, each is charged with cruelty to children, making a false statement and possession of a firearm by a convicted felon, according to an indictment filed Tuesday in Bibb County Superior Court.
Jennings was convicted in 2001 of possession of cocaine with the intent to distribute. Jenkins was convicted in 2002 on charges of terroristic threats and interference with government property, according to the indictment.
Both parents are accused of making a false statement by denying they knew any guns were inside their house.
Jennings additionally is charged with theft by receiving stolen property and obstruction of an officer, according to the court filing.
The gun used in the shooting allegedly was stolen, and authorities contend Jennings “knew or should have known” it was stolen, according to the indictment.
He additionally is accused of removing the gun from the scene of the shooting and trying to hide it from investigators, according to the filing.
Jennings was arrested the night of the shooting.
Information from Telegraph archives was used in this report. To contact writer Amy Leigh Womack, call 744-4398.
